name: Margin of Error
description: The bandit is clearly just philosophically edging you now, it's getting boring... Will you kill 49 in order to save one? How many orders of magnitude will it take for the difference in utility to be a small enough percent for you to give up on your obsession with lever pulling? Is there such a number?

options.name: Human-Dense Track
options.description: Fifty humans are tied down on the route of the oncoming trolley.

options.name: Slightly Less Dense Track
options.description: Forty-Nine humans are tied down, struggling to escape. These people will live, all forty-nine of them, unless you intervene.
